   19: %%
   20: 
   21: -module(op_SUITE).
   22: 
   23: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   24: 
   25: -export([all/0, suite/0,
   26:          bsl_bsr/1,logical/1,t_not/1,relop_simple/1,relop/1,
   27:          complex_relop/1,unsafe_fusing/1,
   28:          range_tests/1,combined_relops/1,typed_relop/1,
   29:          term_equivalence/1]).
   30: 
   31: -import(lists, [foldl/3,flatmap/2]).
   32: 
   33: suite() ->
   34:     [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]},
   35:      {timetrap, {minutes, 5}}].
   36: 
   37: all() ->
   38:     [bsl_bsr, logical, t_not, relop_simple, relop,
   39:      complex_relop, unsafe_fusing, range_tests,
   40:      combined_relops, typed_relop, term_equivalence].
   41: 
   42: %% Test the bsl and bsr operators.
   43: bsl_bsr(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   44:     RawValues = [-16#8000009-2,-1,0,1,2,73,16#8000000,bad,[]],
   45: 
   46:     [bsl_bsr_const(V) || V <- RawValues],
   47: 
   48:     Vs = [unvalue(V) || V <- RawValues],
   49:     %% Try to use less memory by splitting the cases
   50: 
   51:     Cases1 = [{Op,X,Y} || Op <- ['bsl'], X <- Vs, Y <- Vs],
   52:     N1 = length(Cases1),
   53:     run_test_module(Cases1, false),
   54: 
   55:     Cases2 = [{Op,X,Y} || Op <- ['bsr'], X <- Vs, Y <- Vs],
   56:     N2 = length(Cases2),
   57:     run_test_module(Cases2, false),
   58: 
   59:     {comment,integer_to_list(N1 + N2) ++ " cases"}.
   60: 
   61: %% Tests constant-argument optimizations in `bsl`/`bsr`
   62: bsl_bsr_const(A) ->
   63:     BSL = id('bsl'),
   64:     BSR = id('bsr'),
   65: 
   66:     bsl_bsr_compare_results((catch erlang:BSL(1, A)), (catch 1 bsl A)),
   67:     bsl_bsr_compare_results((catch erlang:BSL(3, A)), (catch 3 bsl A)),
   68:     bsl_bsr_compare_results((catch erlang:BSL(7, A)), (catch 7 bsl A)),
   69: 
   70:     bsl_bsr_compare_results((catch erlang:BSL(A, 1)), (catch A bsl 1)),
   71:     bsl_bsr_compare_results((catch erlang:BSL(A, 3)), (catch A bsl 3)),
   72:     bsl_bsr_compare_results((catch erlang:BSL(A, 7)), (catch A bsl 7)),
   73: 
   74:     bsl_bsr_compare_results((catch erlang:BSL(-2, A)), (catch -2 bsl A)),
   75:     bsl_bsr_compare_results((catch erlang:BSL(-4, A)), (catch -4 bsl A)),
   76:     bsl_bsr_compare_results((catch erlang:BSL(-8, A)), (catch -8 bsl A)),
   77: 
   78:     bsl_bsr_compare_results((catch erlang:BSL(A, -2)), (catch A bsl -2)),
   79:     bsl_bsr_compare_results((catch erlang:BSL(A, -4)), (catch A bsl -4)),
   80:     bsl_bsr_compare_results((catch erlang:BSL(A, -8)), (catch A bsl -8)),
   81: 
   82:     bsl_bsr_compare_results((catch erlang:BSR(1, A)), (catch 1 bsr A)),
   83:     bsl_bsr_compare_results((catch erlang:BSR(3, A)), (catch 3 bsr A)),
   84:     bsl_bsr_compare_results((catch erlang:BSR(7, A)), (catch 7 bsr A)),
   85: 
   86:     bsl_bsr_compare_results((catch erlang:BSR(A, 1)), (catch A bsr 1)),
   87:     bsl_bsr_compare_results((catch erlang:BSR(A, 3)), (catch A bsr 3)),
   88:     bsl_bsr_compare_results((catch erlang:BSR(A, 7)), (catch A bsr 7)),
   89: 
   90:     bsl_bsr_compare_results((catch erlang:BSR(-2, A)), (catch -2 bsr A)),
   91:     bsl_bsr_compare_results((catch erlang:BSR(-4, A)), (catch -4 bsr A)),
   92:     bsl_bsr_compare_results((catch erlang:BSR(-8, A)), (catch -8 bsr A)),
   93: 
   94:     bsl_bsr_compare_results((catch erlang:BSR(A, -2)), (catch A bsr -2)),
   95:     bsl_bsr_compare_results((catch erlang:BSR(A, -4)), (catch A bsr -4)),
   96:     bsl_bsr_compare_results((catch erlang:BSR(A, -8)), (catch A bsr -8)),
   97: 
   98: 
   99:     %% These numbers can be shifted left one or zero times while remaining a
  100:     %% small on 32-bit platforms.
  101:     %%
  102:     %% The test relies on the compiler turning these into constants.
  103:     HighEdge32 = (1 bsl (32 - 6)) - 1,
  104:     LowEdge32 = -(1 bsl (32 - 6)),
  105: 
  106:     bsl_bsr_compare_results((catch erlang:BSL(HighEdge32, A)), (catch HighEdge32 bsl A)),
  107:     bsl_bsr_compare_results((catch erlang:BSL(LowEdge32, A)), (catch LowEdge32 bsl A)),
  108:     bsl_bsr_compare_results((catch erlang:BSR(HighEdge32, A)), (catch HighEdge32 bsr A)),
  109:     bsl_bsr_compare_results((catch erlang:BSR(LowEdge32, A)), (catch LowEdge32 bsr A)),
  110: 
  111:     HighEdge64 = (1 bsl (64 - 6)) - 1,
  112:     LowEdge64 = -(1 bsl (64 - 6)),
  113: 
  114:     bsl_bsr_compare_results((catch erlang:BSL(HighEdge64, A)), (catch HighEdge64 bsl A)),
  115:     bsl_bsr_compare_results((catch erlang:BSL(LowEdge64, A)), (catch LowEdge64 bsl A)),
  116:     bsl_bsr_compare_results((catch erlang:BSR(HighEdge64, A)), (catch HighEdge64 bsr A)),
  117:     bsl_bsr_compare_results((catch erlang:BSR(LowEdge64, A)), (catch LowEdge64 bsr A)),
  118: 
  119:     ok.
  120: 
  121: bsl_bsr_compare_results(Same, Same) ->
  122:     ok;
  123: bsl_bsr_compare_results({'EXIT',{Reason,[_|_]}}, {'EXIT',{Reason,[_|_]}}) ->
  124:     %% The applied and inlined implementations may differ in whether they include
  125:     %% the operator as the top element of the stack.
  126:     ok.
  127: 
  128: %% Test the logical operators and internal BIFs.
  129: logical(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  130:     Vs0 = [true,false,bad],
  131:     Vs = [unvalue(V) || V <- Vs0],
  132:     Cases = [{Op,X,Y} || Op <- ['and','or','xor'], X <- Vs, Y <- Vs],
  133:     run_test_module(Cases, false),
  134:     {comment,integer_to_list(length(Cases)) ++ " cases"}.
  135: 
  136: %% Test the not operator and internal BIFs.
  137: t_not(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  138:     Cases = [{'not',unvalue(V)} || V <- [true,false,42,bad]],
  139:     run_test_module(Cases, false),
  140:     {comment,integer_to_list(length(Cases)) ++ " cases"}.
  141: 
  142: %% Test that simlpe relations between relation operators hold.
  143: relop_simple(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  144:     Big1 = 19738924729729787487784874,
  145:     Big2 = 38374938373887374983978484,
  146:     F1 = float(Big1),
  147:     F2 = float(Big2),
  148:     T1 = erlang:make_tuple(3,87),
  149:     T2 = erlang:make_tuple(3,87),
  150:     Terms = [-F2,Big2,-F1,-Big1,-33,-33.0,0,0.0,-0.0,42,42.0,Big1,F1,Big2,F2,
  151:              a,b,{T1,a},{T2,b},[T1,Big1],[T2,Big2]],
  152: 
  153:     Combos = [{V1,V2} || V1 <- Terms, V2 <- Terms],
  154: 
  155:     lists:foreach(fun({A,B}) -> relop_simple_do(A,B) end,
  156:                   Combos),
  157: 
  158:     repeat(fun() ->
  159:                    Size = rand:uniform(100),
  160:                    Rnd1 = make_rand_term(Size),
  161:                    {Rnd2,0} = clone_and_mutate(Rnd1, rand:uniform(Size)),
  162:                    relop_simple_do(Rnd1,Rnd2)
  163:            end,
  164:            1000),
  165:     ok.
  166: 
  167: relop_simple_do(V1,V2) ->
  168:     %%io:format("compare ~p\n   and  ~p\n",[V1,V2]),
  169: 
  170:     L = V1 < V2,
  171:     L = not (V1 >= V2),
  172:     L = V2 > V1,
  173:     L = not (V2 =< V1),
  174: 
  175:     G = V1 > V2,
  176:     G = not (V1 =< V2),
  177:     G = V2 < V1,
  178:     G = not (V2 >= V1),
  179: 
  180:     ID = V1 =:= V2,
  181:     ID = V2 =:= V1,
  182:     ID = not (V1 =/= V2),
  183:     ID = not (V2 =/= V1),
  184: 
  185:     implies(ID, V1 == V2),
  186: 
  187:     EQ = V1 == V2,
  188:     EQ = V2 == V1,
  189:     EQ = not (V1 /= V2),
  190:     EQ = not (V2 /= V1),
  191: 
  192:     case {L, EQ, ID, G, cmp_emu(V1,V2)} of
  193:         { true, false, false, false, -1} -> ok;
  194:         {false, true,  false, false,  0} -> ok;
  195:         {false, true,   true, false,  0} -> ok;
  196:         {false, false, false, true,  +1} -> ok
  197:     end.
  198: 
  199: implies(false, _) -> ok;
  200: implies(true, true) -> ok.
  201: 
  202: %% Emulate internal "cmp"
  203: cmp_emu(A,B) when is_tuple(A), is_tuple(B) ->
  204:     SA = size(A),
  205:     SB = size(B),
  206:     if SA =:= SB -> cmp_emu(tuple_to_list(A),tuple_to_list(B));
  207:        SA > SB -> +1;
  208:        SA < SB -> -1
  209:     end;
  210: cmp_emu([A|TA],[B|TB]) ->
  211:     case cmp_emu(A,B) of
  212:         0   -> cmp_emu(TA,TB);
  213:         CMP -> CMP
  214:     end;
  215: cmp_emu(A,B) ->
  216:     %% We cheat and use real "cmp" for the primitive types.
  217:     if A < B -> -1;
  218:        A > B -> +1;
  219:        true -> 0
  220:     end.					              
  221: 
  222: make_rand_term(1) ->
  223:     make_rand_term_single();
  224: make_rand_term(Arity) ->
  225:     case rand:uniform(3) of
  226:         1 ->
  227:             make_rand_list(Arity);
  228:         2 ->
  229:             list_to_tuple(make_rand_list(Arity));
  230:         3 ->
  231:             {Car,Rest} = make_rand_term_rand_size(Arity),
  232:             [Car|make_rand_term(Rest)]
  233:     end.
  234: 
  235: make_rand_term_single() ->
  236:     Range = 1 bsl rand:uniform(200),
  237:     case rand:uniform(12) of
  238:         1 -> random;
  239:         2 -> uniform;
  240:         3 -> rand:uniform(Range) - (Range div 2);
  241:         4 -> Range * (rand:uniform() - 0.5);
  242:         5 -> 0;
  243:         6 -> 0.0;
  244:         7 -> make_ref();
  245:         8 -> self();
  246:         9 -> term_to_binary(rand:uniform(Range));
  247:         10 -> fun(X) -> X*Range end; 
  248:         11 -> fun(X) -> X/Range end;
  249:         12 -> []
  250:     end.	    
  251: 
  252: make_rand_term_rand_size(1) ->
  253:     {make_rand_term(1), 0};
  254: make_rand_term_rand_size(MaxArity) ->
  255:     Arity = rand:uniform(MaxArity-1),
  256:     {make_rand_term(Arity), MaxArity-Arity}.
  257: 
  258: make_rand_list(0) -> [];
  259: make_rand_list(Arity) ->
  260:     {Term, Rest} = make_rand_term_rand_size(Arity),
  261:     [Term | make_rand_list(Rest)].
  262: 
  263: 
  264: clone_and_mutate(Term, 0) ->
  265:     {clone(Term), 0};
  266: clone_and_mutate(_Term, 1) ->
  267:     {Mutation, _} = make_rand_term_rand_size(10), % MUTATE!
  268:     {Mutation, 0};
  269: clone_and_mutate(Term, Cnt) when is_tuple(Term) ->
  270:     {Clone,NewCnt} = clone_and_mutate(tuple_to_list(Term),Cnt),
  271:     {my_list_to_tuple(Clone), NewCnt};
  272: clone_and_mutate([Term|Tail], Cnt) ->
  273:     {Car,Cnt1} = clone_and_mutate(Term,Cnt),
  274:     {Cdr,Cnt2} = clone_and_mutate(Tail,Cnt1),
  275:     {[Car | Cdr], Cnt2};
  276: clone_and_mutate(Term, Cnt) ->
  277:     {clone(Term), Cnt-1}.
  278: 
  279: clone(Term) ->
  280:     binary_to_term(term_to_binary(Term)).
  281: 
  282: my_list_to_tuple(List) ->
  283:     try list_to_tuple(List)
  284:     catch
  285:         error:badarg -> 
  286:             %%io:format("my_list_to_tuple got badarg exception.\n"),
  287:             list_to_tuple(purify_list(List))
  288:     end.
  289: 
  290: purify_list(List) ->
  291:     lists:reverse(purify_list(List, [])).
  292: purify_list([], Acc) -> Acc;
  293: purify_list([H|T], Acc) -> purify_list(T, [H|Acc]);
  294: purify_list(Other, Acc) -> [Other|Acc].
  295: 
  296: 
  297: %% Test the relational operators and internal BIFs on literals.
  298: relop(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  299:     Big1 = -38374938373887374983978484,
  300:     Big2 = 19738924729729787487784874,
  301:     F1 = float(Big1),
  302:     F2 = float(Big2),
  303:     Bin = <<"abc">>,
  304:     BitString = <<0:7>>,
  305:     Map = #{a => b},
  306:     Vs0 = [a,b,-33,-33.0,0,0.0,-0,0,42,42.0,Big1,Big2,F1,F2,
  307:            Bin,BitString,Map,[16#1234_5678_abcd]],
  308:     Vs = [unvalue(V) || V <- Vs0],
  309:     Ops = ['==', '/=', '=:=', '=/=', '<', '=<', '>', '>='],
  310:     binop(Ops, Vs).
  311: 
  312: %% Test the relational operators and internal BIFs on lists and tuples.
  313: complex_relop(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  314:     Big = 99678557475484872464269855544643333,
  315:     Float = float(Big),
  316:     Bin = <<"abc">>,
  317:     BitString = <<0:7>>,
  318:     EmptyBitString = <<>>,
  319:     Map = #{a => b},
  320:     EmptyMap = #{},
  321:     Vs0 = [an_atom,42.0,42,0.0,-0.0,Big,Float,Bin,BitString,
  322:            EmptyBitString,Map,EmptyMap],
  323:     Vs = flatmap(fun(X) -> [unvalue({X}),unvalue([X])] end, Vs0),
  324:     Ops = ['==', '/=', '=:=', '=/=', '<', '=<', '>', '>='],
  325:     binop(Ops, Vs).
  326: 
  327: binop(Ops, Vs) ->
  328:     Run = fun(Op, N) -> Cases = [{Op,V1,V2} || V1 <- Vs, V2 <- Vs],
  329:                         run_test_module(Cases, true),
  330:                         N + length(Cases) end,
  331:     NumCases = foldl(Run, 0, Ops),
  332:     {comment,integer_to_list(NumCases) ++ " cases"}.
  333: 
  334: run_test_module(Cases, GuardsOk) ->
  335:     Es = [expr(C) || C <- Cases],
  336:     Ok = unvalue(ok),
  337:     Gts = case GuardsOk of
  338:               true ->
  339:                   Ges = [guard_expr(C) || C <- Cases],
  340:                   lists:foldr(fun guard_test/2, [Ok], Ges);
  341:               false ->
  342:                   [Ok]
  343:           end,
  344:     Fun1 = make_function(guard_tests, Gts),
  345:     Bts = lists:foldr(fun body_test/2, [Ok], Es),
  346:     Fun2 = make_function(body_tests, Bts),
  347:     Bbts = lists:foldr(fun internal_bif/2, [Ok], Es),
  348:     Fun3 = make_function(bif_tests, Bbts),
  349:     Id = {function,1,id,1,[{clause,1,[{var,1,'I'}],[],[{var,1,'I'}]}]},
  350:     Module0 = make_module(op_tests, [Fun1,Fun2,Fun3,Id]),
  351:     Module = erl_parse:new_anno(Module0),
  352:     lists:foreach(fun(F) -> io:put_chars([erl_pp:form(F),"\n"]) end, Module),
  353: 
  354:     %% Compile, load, and run the generated module. Test both with and
  355:     %% without compiler optimizations to ensure that we test both the
  356:     %% implementation of the BIFs and the BEAM instructions.
  357:     do_run_test_module(Module, []),
  358:     do_run_test_module(Module, [no_copt,no_ssa_opt,no_postopt]).
  359: 
  360: do_run_test_module(Module, Opts) ->
  361:     {ok,Mod,Code1} = compile:forms(Module, [time|Opts]),
  362:     _ = code:delete(Mod),
  363:     _ = code:purge(Mod),
  364: 
  365:     {module,Mod} = code:load_binary(Mod, Mod, Code1),
  366: 
  367:     run_function(Mod, guard_tests),
  368:     run_function(Mod, body_tests),
  369:     run_function(Mod, bif_tests),
  370: 
  371:     true = code:delete(Mod),
  372:     _ = code:purge(Mod),
  373: 
  374:     ok.
  375: 
  376: expr({Op,X}) ->
  377:     E = {op,1,Op,{call,1,{atom,1,id},[X]}},
  378:     Res = eval([{op,1,Op,X}]),
  379:     {E,{Op,X},Res};
  380: expr({Op,X,Y}) ->
  381:     E = {op,1,Op,{call,1,{atom,1,id},[X]},Y},
  382:     Res = eval([{op,1,Op,X,Y}]),
  383:     {E,{Op,value(X),value(Y)},Res}.
  384: 
  385: guard_expr({Op,X}) ->
  386:     E = {op,1,Op,X},
  387:     Res = eval([E]),
  388:     {E,{Op,X},Res};
  389: guard_expr({Op,X,Y}) ->
  390:     E = {op,1,Op,X,Y},
  391:     Res = eval([E]),
  392:     {E,{Op,value(X),value(Y)},Res}.
  393: 
  394: run_function(Mod, Name) ->
  395:     case catch Mod:Name() of
  396:         {'EXIT',Reason} ->
  397:             io:format("~p", [get(last)]),
  398:             ct:fail({'EXIT',Reason});
  399:         _Other ->
  400:             ok
  401:     end.
  402: 
  403: guard_test({E,Expr,Res}, Tail) ->
  404:     True = unvalue(true),
  405:     [save_term(Expr),
  406:      {match,1,unvalue(Res),
  407:       {'if',1,[{clause,1,[],[[E]],[True]},
  408:                {clause,1,[],[[True]],[unvalue(false)]}]}}|Tail].
  409: 
  410: body_test({E,Expr,{'EXIT',_}}, Tail) ->
  411:     [save_term(Expr),
  412:      {match,1,{tuple,1,[unvalue('EXIT'), {var,1,'_'}]},
  413:       {'catch',1,E}}|Tail];
  414: body_test({E,Expr,Res}, Tail) ->
  415:     [save_term(Expr),
  416:      {match,1,unvalue(Res),E}|Tail].
  417: 
  418: internal_bif({{op,_,Op,X},Expr,Res}, Tail) ->
  419:     internal_bif(Op, [X], Expr, Res, Tail);
  420: internal_bif({{op,_,Op,X,Y},Expr,Res}, Tail) ->
  421:     internal_bif(Op, [X,Y], Expr, Res, Tail).
  422: 
  423: internal_bif(Op, Args, Expr, {'EXIT',_}, Tail) ->
  424:     [save_term(Expr),
  425:      {match,1,{tuple,1,[unvalue('EXIT'), {var,1,'_'}]},
  426:       {'catch',1,{call,1,{remote,1,{atom,1,erlang},unvalue(Op)},Args}}}|Tail];
  427: internal_bif(Op, Args, Expr, Res, Tail) ->
  428:     [save_term(Expr),
  429:      {match,1,unvalue(Res),
  430:       {call,1,{remote,1,{atom,1,erlang},unvalue(Op)},Args}}|Tail].
  431: 
  432: save_term(Term) ->
  433:     {call,1,
  434:      {atom,1,put},
  435:      [{atom,1,last},unvalue(Term)]}.
  436: 
  437: make_module(Name, Funcs) ->
  438:     [{attribute,1,module,Name},
  439:      {attribute,0,compile,export_all} |
  440:      Funcs ++ [{eof,0}]].
  441: 
  442: make_function(Name, Body) ->
  443:     {function,1,Name,0,[{clause,1,[],[],Body}]}.
  444: 
  445: eval(E0) ->
  446:     E = erl_parse:new_anno(E0),
  447:     case catch erl_eval:exprs(E, []) of
  448:         {'EXIT',Reason} -> {'EXIT',Reason};
  449:         {value,Val,_Bs} -> Val
  450:     end.
  451: 
  452: unsafe_fusing(_Config) ->
  453:     0 = usec_to_seconds(id(1)),
  454:     234_567 = usec_to_seconds(id(1_234_567_890*1_000)),
  455:     ok.
  456: 
  457: usec_to_seconds(Usec) when is_integer(Usec) ->
  458:     %% The introduction of typed operands caused the loader
  459:     %% to incorrectly fuse the following instrutions because
  460:     %% the result register ({x,0}) from the 'div' instruction
  461:     %% seemed to be distinct from both operands of the 'rem'
  462:     %% instruction:
  463:     %%
  464:     %% {gc_bif,'div',
  465:     %%         {f,0},
  466:     %%         1,
  467:     %%         [{tr,{x,0},{t_integer,any}},{integer,1000000}],
  468:     %%         {x,0}}.
  469:     %% {gc_bif,'rem',
  470:     %%         {f,0},
  471:     %%         1,
  472:     %%         [{tr,{x,0},{t_integer,any}},{integer,1000000}],
  473:     %%         {x,0}}.
  474:     Sec = Usec div 1000000,
  475:     Sec rem 1000000.
  476: 
  477: range_tests(_Config) ->
  478:     %% Define the limits for smalls on a 64-bit system.
  479:     {MinSmall, MaxSmall} = {-1 bsl 59, (1 bsl 59) - 1},
  480:     case erlang:system_info(wordsize) of
  481:         8 ->
  482:             %% Assertions.
  483:             2 = erts_debug:flat_size(MinSmall-1),
  484:             0 = erts_debug:flat_size(MinSmall),
  485:             0 = erts_debug:flat_size(MaxSmall),
  486:             2 = erts_debug:flat_size(MaxSmall+1);
  487:         4 ->
  488:             ok
  489:     end,
  490: 
  491:     lesser = range(-1 bsl 64),
  492:     lesser = range(MinSmall),
  493:     lesser = range(0),
  494:     lesser = range(-1),
  495:     lesser = range(0.9999),
  496: 
  497:     inside = range_any(1),
  498:     inside = range_any(2),
  499:     inside = range_any(2.5),
  500:     inside = range_any(math:pi()),
  501:     inside = range_any(5),
  502:     inside = range_any(9),
  503:     inside = range_any(10),
  504: 
  505:     greater = range(10.0001),
  506:     greater = range(11),
  507:     greater = range(MaxSmall),
  508:     greater = range(1 bsl 64),
  509:     greater = range(atom),
  510:     greater = range(self()),
  511:     greater = range(make_ref()),
  512:     greater = range({a,b}),
  513:     greater = range([a,b]),
  514:     greater = range([]),
  515:     greater = range(<<1,2,3>>),
  516:     greater = range(fun() -> ok end),
  517:     greater = range(fun ?MODULE:range_tests/1),
  518: 
  519:     lesser = range(-1 bsl 64),
  520:     lesser = range(float(-1 bsl 64)),
  521:     lesser = range_big(MinSmall - 2),
  522:     lesser = range_barely_small(MinSmall - 1),
  523: 
  524:     inside = range_barely_small(MinSmall),
  525:     inside = range_barely_small(-1 bsl 58),
  526:     inside = range_barely_small(0),
  527:     inside = range_barely_small(17.75),
  528:     inside = range_barely_small(1 bsl 58),
  529:     inside = range_barely_small(MaxSmall),
  530: 
  531:     greater = range_barely_small(MaxSmall + 1),
  532:     greater = range_big(MaxSmall + 2),
  533:     greater = range_big(1 bsl 64),
  534:     greater = range_big(float(1 bsl 64)),
  535: 
  536:     lesser = range(-1 bsl 64),
  537:     lesser = range(float(-1 bsl 64)),
  538:     lesser = range_big(MinSmall - 2),
  539: 
  540:     inside = range_big(MinSmall),
  541:     inside = range_big(-1 bsl 58),
  542:     inside = range_big(0),
  543:     inside = range_big(17.75),
  544:     inside = range_big(1 bsl 58),
  545:     inside = range_big(MaxSmall),
  546: 
  547:     greater = range_big(MaxSmall + 2),
  548:     greater = range_big(1 bsl 64),
  549:     greater = range_big(float(1 bsl 64)),
  550: 
  551:     inside = int_range_1(id(-100_000)),
  552:     inside = int_range_1(id(-10)),
  553:     inside = int_range_1(id(100)),
  554:     inside = int_range_1(id(100_000)),
  555: 
  556:     outside = int_range_1(id(atom)),
  557:     outside = int_range_1(id(-1 bsl 60)),
  558:     outside = int_range_1(id(-100_001)),
  559:     outside = int_range_1(id(100_001)),
  560:     outside = int_range_1(id(1 bsl 60)),
  561: 
  562:     inside = int_range_2(id(1)),
  563:     inside = int_range_2(id(42)),
  564:     inside = int_range_2(id(16#f000_0000)),
  565: 
  566:     outside = int_range_2(id([a,list])),
  567:     outside = int_range_2(id(0)),
  568:     outside = int_range_1(id(-1 bsl 60)),
  569:     outside = int_range_1(id(1 bsl 60)),
  570: 
  571:     inside = int_range_3(id(1 bsl 28)),
  572:     inside = int_range_3(id((1 bsl 28) + 1)),
  573:     inside = int_range_3(id((1 bsl 33) + 555)),
  574:     inside = int_range_3(id((1 bsl 58) - 1)),
  575:     inside = int_range_3(id(1 bsl 58)),
  576: 
  577:     outside = int_range_3(id({a,tuple})),
  578:     outside = int_range_3(id(-1 bsl 60)),
  579:     outside = int_range_3(id(-1000)),
  580:     outside = int_range_3(id(100)),
  581:     outside = int_range_3(id((1 bsl 58) + 1)),
  582:     outside = int_range_3(id(1 bsl 60)),
  583: 
  584:     ok.
  585: 
  586: range(X) ->
  587:     Res = range_any(X),
  588:     if
  589:         is_integer(X) ->
  590:             Res = range_any(float(X)),
  591:             Res = range_number(X),
  592:             Res = range_number(float(X)),
  593:             Res = range_int(X),
  594:             if
  595:                 X =:= X band 16#ffff ->
  596:                     Res = range_small_int(X);
  597:                 true ->
  598:                     Res
  599:             end;
  600:         is_number(X) ->
  601:             Res = range_number(X);
  602:         true ->
  603:             Res = range_big(X),
  604:             Res = range_barely_small(X)
  605:     end.
  606: 
  607: range_any(X0) ->
  608:     X = id(X0),
  609:     case range_any_1(X) of
  610:         inside ->
  611:             inside = range_any_2(X);
  612:         Other ->
  613:             outside = range_any_2(X),
  614:             Other
  615:     end.
  616: 
  617: %% The guard tests have different failure labels.
  618: range_any_1(X) when 1 =< X, X =< 10 ->
  619:     inside;
  620: range_any_1(X) when X < 1 ->
  621:     lesser;
  622: range_any_1(X) when X > 10 ->
  623:     greater.
  624: 
  625: %% The guard tests have the same failure label.
  626: range_any_2(X) when 1 =< X, X =< 10 ->
  627:     inside;
  628: range_any_2(_) ->
  629:     outside.
  630: 
  631: range_number(X) when is_number(X) ->
  632:     case range_number_1(X) of
  633:         inside ->
  634:             inside = range_number_2(X);
  635:         Other ->
  636:             outside = range_number_2(X),
  637:             Other
  638:     end.
  639: 
  640: range_number_1(X) when 1 =< X, X =< 10 ->
  641:     inside;
  642: range_number_1(X) when X < 1 ->
  643:     lesser;
  644: range_number_1(X) when X > 10 ->
  645:     greater.
  646: 
  647: range_number_2(X) when 1 =< X, X =< 10 ->
  648:     inside;
  649: range_number_2(_) ->
  650:     outside.
  651: 
  652: range_int(X) when is_integer(X) ->
  653:     case range_int_1(X) of
  654:         inside ->
  655:             inside = range_int_2(X);
  656:         Other ->
  657:             outside = range_int_2(X),
  658:             Other
  659:     end.
  660: 
  661: range_int_1(X) when 1 =< X, X =< 10 ->
  662:     inside;
  663: range_int_1(X) when X < 1 ->
  664:     lesser;
  665: range_int_1(X) when X > 10 ->
  666:     greater.
  667: 
  668: range_int_2(X) when 1 =< X, X =< 10 ->
  669:     inside;
  670: range_int_2(_) ->
  671:     outside.
  672: 
  673: range_small_int(X) when is_integer(X) ->
  674:     case range_small_int_1(X) of
  675:         inside ->
  676:             inside = range_small_int_2(X);
  677:         Other ->
  678:             outside = range_small_int_2(X),
  679:             Other
  680:     end.
  681: 
  682: range_small_int_1(X) when 1 =< X, X =< 10 ->
  683:     inside;
  684: range_small_int_1(X) when X < 1 ->
  685:     lesser;
  686: range_small_int_1(X) when X > 10 ->
  687:     greater.
  688: 
  689: range_small_int_2(X) when 1 =< X, X =< 10 ->
  690:     inside;
  691: range_small_int_2(_) ->
  692:     outside.
  693: 
  694: range_barely_small(X) ->
  695:     case range_barely_small_1(X) of
  696:         inside ->
  697:             inside = range_barely_small_2(X);
  698:         Other ->
  699:             outside = range_barely_small_2(X),
  700:             Other
  701:     end.
  702: 
  703: range_barely_small_1(X) when -1 bsl 59 =< X, X =< (1 bsl 59) - 1 ->
  704:     inside;
  705: range_barely_small_1(X) when X < -1 bsl 59 ->
  706:     lesser;
  707: range_barely_small_1(X) when X > (1 bsl 59) - 1 ->
  708:     greater.
  709: 
  710: range_barely_small_2(X) when -1 bsl 59 =< X, X =< (1 bsl 59) - 1 ->
  711:     inside;
  712: range_barely_small_2(_) ->
  713:     outside.
  714: 
  715: range_big(X) ->
  716:     case range_big_1(X) of
  717:         inside ->
  718:             inside = range_big_2(X);
  719:         Other ->
  720:             outside = range_big_2(X),
  721:             Other
  722:     end.
  723: 
  724: range_big_1(X) when (-1 bsl 59) - 1 =< X, X =< 1 bsl 59 ->
  725:     inside;
  726: range_big_1(X) when X < (-1 bsl 59) - 1 ->
  727:     lesser;
  728: range_big_1(X) when X > 1 bsl 59 ->
  729:     greater.
  730: 
  731: range_big_2(X) when (-1 bsl 59) - 1 =< X, X =< 1 bsl 59 ->
  732:     inside;
  733: range_big_2(_) ->
  734:     outside.
  735: 
  736: int_range_1(X) when is_integer(X), -100_000 =< X, X =< 100_000 ->
  737:     inside;
  738: int_range_1(_) ->
  739:     outside.
  740: 
  741: int_range_2(X) when is_integer(X), 1 =< X, X =< 16#f000_0000 ->
  742:     inside;
  743: int_range_2(_) ->
  744:     outside.
  745: 
  746: int_range_3(X) when is_integer(X), 1 bsl 28 =< X, X =< 1 bsl 58 ->
  747:     inside;
  748: int_range_3(_) ->
  749:     outside.
  750: 
  751: combined_relops(_Config) ->
  752:     other = test_tok_char(-1 bsl 64),
  753:     other = test_tok_char($A - 1),
  754: 
  755:     var = test_tok_char($A),
  756:     var = test_tok_char($B),
  757:     var = test_tok_char($P),
  758:     var = test_tok_char($Y),
  759:     var = test_tok_char($Z),
  760: 
  761:     other = test_tok_char($Z + 1),
  762: 
  763:     var = tok_char($_),
  764:     other = tok_char(float($_)),
  765: 
  766:     other = test_tok_char(1 bsl 64),
  767: 
  768:     other = test_tok_char(atom),
  769:     other = test_tok_char(self()),
  770: 
  771:     %%
  772:     b = ge_ge_int_range_1(-200),
  773:     b = ge_ge_int_range_1(-101),
  774: 
  775:     a = ge_ge_int_range_1(-100),
  776:     a = ge_ge_int_range_1(-50),
  777:     a = ge_ge_int_range_1(-10),
  778: 
  779:     b = ge_ge_int_range_1(-9),
  780:     b = ge_ge_int_range_1(-6),
  781: 
  782:     a = ge_ge_int_range_1(-5),
  783: 
  784:     b = ge_ge_int_range_1(-4),
  785:     b = ge_ge_int_range_1(0),
  786:     b = ge_ge_int_range_1(42),
  787: 
  788:     %%
  789:     b = ge_ge_int_range_2(-1 bsl 59),
  790: 
  791:     a = ge_ge_int_range_2((-1 bsl 59) + 1),
  792:     a = ge_ge_int_range_2(-1 bsl 58),
  793:     a = ge_ge_int_range_2(-1000),
  794:     a = ge_ge_int_range_2(1 bsl 58),
  795:     a = ge_ge_int_range_2((1 bsl 59) - 10),
  796: 
  797:     b = ge_ge_int_range_2((1 bsl 59) - 9),
  798: 
  799:     a = ge_ge_int_range_2((1 bsl 59) - 5),
  800: 
  801:     b = ge_ge_int_range_2((1 bsl 59) - 4),
  802:     b = ge_ge_int_range_2((1 bsl 59) - 1),
  803: 
  804:     %%
  805:     b = ge_ge_int_range_3(-1 bsl 59),
  806: 
  807:     b = ge_ge_int_range_3((-1 bsl 59) + 1),
  808:     b = ge_ge_int_range_3(-1 bsl 58),
  809:     b = ge_ge_int_range_3(-1000),
  810:     b = ge_ge_int_range_3(1 bsl 58),
  811: 
  812:     a = ge_ge_int_range_3((1 bsl 59) - 20),
  813:     a = ge_ge_int_range_3((1 bsl 59) - 15),
  814:     a = ge_ge_int_range_3((1 bsl 59) - 10),
  815: 
  816:     b = ge_ge_int_range_3((1 bsl 59) - 9),
  817: 
  818:     a = ge_ge_int_range_3((1 bsl 59) - 5),
  819: 
  820:     b = ge_ge_int_range_3((1 bsl 59) - 4),
  821:     b = ge_ge_int_range_3((1 bsl 59) - 1),
  822: 
  823:     %%
  824:     b = ge_ge_int_range_4(-1 bsl 59),
  825: 
  826:     a = ge_ge_int_range_4((-1 bsl 59) + 1),
  827:     a = ge_ge_int_range_4((-1 bsl 59) + 3),
  828:     a = ge_ge_int_range_4((-1 bsl 59) + 5),
  829: 
  830:     b = ge_ge_int_range_4((-1 bsl 59) + 6),
  831:     b = ge_ge_int_range_4((-1 bsl 59) + 9),
  832: 
  833:     a = ge_ge_int_range_4((-1 bsl 59) + 10),
  834: 
  835:     b = ge_ge_int_range_4((-1 bsl 59) + 11),
  836: 
  837:     b = ge_ge_int_range_4(0),
  838:     b = ge_ge_int_range_4(1000),
  839: 
  840:     b = ge_ge_int_range_4((1 bsl 59) - 1),
  841: 
  842:     %% Test a sequence that can't occur in optimized code:
  843:     %%   is_ge Fail Src 10
  844:     %%   is_ge Fail Src 5
  845:     Module = {?FUNCTION_NAME,[{test,1}],[],
  846:               [{function, test, 1, 2,
  847:                 [{label,1},
  848:                  {line,[{location,"t.erl",4}]},
  849:                  {func_info,{atom,?FUNCTION_NAME},{atom,test},1},
  850:                  {label,2},
  851:                  {test,is_ge,{f,4},
  852:                   [{tr,{x,0},{t_integer,{0,1000}}},
  853:                    {integer,10}]},
  854:                  {test,is_ge,
  855:                   {f,3},
  856:                   [{tr,{x,0},{t_integer,{0,1000}}},
  857:                    {integer,5}]},
  858:                  {label,3},
  859:                  {move,{atom,a},{x,0}},
  860:                  return,
  861:                  {label,4},
  862:                  {move,{atom,b},{x,0}},
  863:                  return]}],
  864:               5},
  865: 
  866:     {ok,Mod,Code} = compile:forms(Module, [from_asm,time,report]),
  867:     {module,Mod} = code:load_binary(Mod, Mod, Code),
  868: 
  869:     b = Mod:test(0),
  870:     b = Mod:test(5),
  871:     b = Mod:test(9),
  872: 
  873:     a = Mod:test(10),
  874:     a = Mod:test(11),
  875:     a = Mod:test(1000),
  876: 
  877:     true = code:delete(Mod),
  878:     _ = code:purge(Mod),
  879: 
  880:     ok.
  881: 
  882: test_tok_char(C) ->
  883:     Result = tok_char(C),
  884:     if
  885:         is_integer(C) ->
  886:             Result = tok_char(float(C)),
  887:             Result = tok_char_int(C),
  888:             if
  889:                 C band 16#FFFF =:= C ->
  890:                     Result = tok_char_int_range(C);
  891:                 true ->
  892:                     Result
  893:             end;
  894:         true ->
  895:             Result
  896:     end.
  897: 
  898: %% is_ge + is_lt
  899: tok_char(C) when $A =< C, C =< $Z ->
  900:     var;
  901: tok_char($_) ->
  902:     var;
  903: tok_char(_) ->
  904:     other.
  905: 
  906: %% is_ge + is_ge
  907: tok_char_int(C) when $A =< C, C =< $Z ->
  908:     var;
  909: tok_char_int($_) ->
  910:     var;
  911: tok_char_int(_) ->
  912:     other.
  913: 
  914: %% is_ge + is_ge
  915: tok_char_int_range(C) when $A =< C, C =< $Z ->
  916:     var;
  917: tok_char_int_range($_) ->
  918:     var;
  919: tok_char_int_range(_) ->
  920:     other.
  921: 
  922: %% is_ge + is_ge
  923: ge_ge_int_range_1(X) when -100 =< X, X =< -10 ->
  924:     a;
  925: ge_ge_int_range_1(-5) ->
  926:     a;
  927: ge_ge_int_range_1(_) ->
  928:     b.
  929: 
  930: ge_ge_int_range_2(X) when (-1 bsl 59) + 1 =< X, X =< (1 bsl 59) - 10 ->
  931:     a;
  932: ge_ge_int_range_2((1 bsl 59) - 5) ->
  933:     a;
  934: ge_ge_int_range_2(_) ->
  935:     b.
  936: 
  937: ge_ge_int_range_3(X) when (1 bsl 59) - 20 =< X, X =< (1 bsl 59) - 10 ->
  938:     a;
  939: ge_ge_int_range_3((1 bsl 59) - 5) ->
  940:     a;
  941: ge_ge_int_range_3(_) ->
  942:     b.
  943: 
  944: ge_ge_int_range_4(X) when (-1 bsl 59) + 1 =< X, X =< (-1 bsl 59) + 5 ->
  945:     a;
  946: ge_ge_int_range_4((-1 bsl 59) + 10) ->
  947:     a;
  948: ge_ge_int_range_4(_) ->
  949:     b.
  950: 
  951: %% Tests operators where type hints are significant.
  952: typed_relop(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  953:     _ = [compare_integer_pid(1 bsl N) || N <- lists:seq(1, 64)],
  954: 
  955:     {error,<<7:3>>} = compare_bitstring({text, <<7:3>>, 0}),
  956:     {error,<<0:8>>} = compare_bitstring({text, <<0:8>>, 0}),
  957:     {error,<<0:9>>} = compare_bitstring({text, <<0:9>>, 0}),
  958:     {text, 42} = compare_bitstring({text, <<0:3>>, 42}),
  959: 
  960:     {error,<<7:3>>} = compare_bitstring({binary, <<7:3>>, 0}),
  961:     {error,<<0:8>>} = compare_bitstring({binary, <<0:8>>, 0}),
  962:     {error,<<0:9>>} = compare_bitstring({binary, <<0:9>>, 0}),
  963:     {binary, 42} = compare_bitstring({binary, <<0:3>>, 42}),
  964: 
  965:     negative = classify_value(id(-1 bsl 128)),
  966:     other = classify_value(id(0)),
  967:     other = classify_value(id(42)),
  968:     other = classify_value(id(1 bsl 64)),
  969:     other = classify_value(id(a)),
  970: 
  971:     ok.
  972: 
  973: compare_integer_pid(N) when is_integer(N) ->
  974:     Immed = self(),
  975:     true = is_pid(Immed),
  976:     if
  977:         N >= Immed -> ct:fail("integer compared greater than pid");
  978:         N < Immed -> ok
  979:     end.
  980: 
  981: %% GH-7433. Equality and non-equality tests with a bitstring could fail when it
  982: %% should succeed and vice versa.
  983: compare_bitstring({text, Res, _Data}) when is_bitstring(Res), Res =/= <<0:3>> ->
  984:     {error, Res};
  985: compare_bitstring({binary, Res, _Data}) when is_bitstring(Res), Res =/= <<0:3>> ->
  986:     {error, Res};
  987: compare_bitstring({binary, _Res, Data}) ->
  988:     {binary, Data};
  989: compare_bitstring({text, _Res, Data}) ->
  990:     {text, Data}.
  991: 
  992: classify_value(N) when is_integer(N), N < 0 ->
  993:     negative;
  994: classify_value(_N) ->
  995:     other.
  996: 
  997: term_equivalence(_Config) ->
  998:     %% Term equivalence has been tested before in this suite, but we need to
  999:     %% massage some edge cases that cannot easily be put into the other test
 1000:     %% cases.
 1001:     <<PosZero/float>> = id(<<0:1,0:63>>),
 1002:     <<NegZero/float>> = id(<<1:1,0:63>>),
 1003: 
 1004:     +0.0 = id(PosZero),
 1005:     -0.0 = id(NegZero),
 1006: 
 1007:     -1 = erts_internal:cmp_term(NegZero, PosZero),
 1008:     1 = erts_internal:cmp_term(PosZero, NegZero),
 1009: 
 1010:     -1 = cmp_float(NegZero, PosZero),
 1011:     1 = cmp_float(PosZero, NegZero),
 1012: 
 1013:     Floats = [0.0, -0.0, 4711.0, -4711.0, 12.0, 943.0],
 1014: 
 1015:     [true = (cmp_float(A, B) =:= erts_internal:cmp_term(A, B)) ||
 1016:      A <- Floats, B <- Floats],
 1017: 
 1018:     ok.
 1019: 
 1020: cmp_float(A0, B0) ->
 1021:     A = float_comparable(A0),
 1022:     B = float_comparable(B0),
 1023:     if
 1024:         A < B -> -1;
 1025:         A > B -> +1;
 1026:         A =:= B -> 0
 1027:     end.
 1028: 
 1029: %% Converts a float to a number which, when compared with other such converted
 1030: %% floats, is ordered the same as '<' on the original inputs aside from the
 1031: %% fact that -0.0 < +0.0 as required by the term equivalence order.
 1032: %%
 1033: %% This has been proven correct with the SMT-LIB model below:
 1034: %%
 1035: %% (define-const SignBit_bv (_ BitVec 64) #x8000000000000000)
 1036: %% 
 1037: %% ; Two finite floats X and Y of unknown value
 1038: %% (declare-const X (_ FloatingPoint 11 53))
 1039: %% (declare-const Y (_ FloatingPoint 11 53))
 1040: %% (assert (= false (fp.isInfinite X) (fp.isInfinite Y)
 1041: %%            (fp.isNaN X) (fp.isNaN Y)))
 1042: %% 
 1043: %% ; ... the bit representations of the aforementioned floats. The Z3 floating-
 1044: %% ; point extension lacks a way to directly bit-cast a vector to a float, so
 1045: %% ; we rely on equivalence here.
 1046: %% (declare-const X_bv (_ BitVec 64))
 1047: %% (declare-const Y_bv (_ BitVec 64))
 1048: %% (assert (= ((_ to_fp 11 53) X_bv) X))
 1049: %% (assert (= ((_ to_fp 11 53) Y_bv) Y))
 1050: %% 
 1051: %% ; The bit hack we're going to test
 1052: %% (define-fun float_sortable ((value (_ BitVec 64))) (_ BitVec 64)
 1053: %% (ite (distinct (bvand value SignBit_bv) SignBit_bv)
 1054: %%  (bvxor value SignBit_bv)
 1055: %%  (bvnot value)))
 1056: %% 
 1057: %% (define-fun float_bv_lt ((LHS (_ BitVec 64))
 1058: %%                          (RHS (_ BitVec 64))) Bool
 1059: %%  (bvult (float_sortable LHS) (float_sortable RHS)))
 1060: %% 
 1061: %% (push 1)
 1062: %%   ; When either of X or Y are non-zero, (X < Y) = (bvX < bvY)
 1063: %%   (assert (not (and (fp.isZero X) (fp.isZero Y))))
 1064: %%   (assert (distinct (fp.lt X Y) (float_bv_lt X_bv Y_bv)))
 1065: %%   (check-sat) ; unsat, proving by negation that the above always holds
 1066: %% (pop 1)
 1067: %% 
 1068: %% (push 1)
 1069: %%   ; Negative zero should sort lower than positive zero
 1070: %%   (assert (and (fp.isNegative X) (fp.isPositive Y)
 1071: %%                (fp.isZero X) (fp.isZero Y)))
 1072: %%   (assert (not (float_bv_lt X_bv Y_bv)))
 1073: %%   (check-sat) ; unsat
 1074: %% (pop 1)
 1075: float_comparable(V0) ->
 1076:     Sign = 16#8000000000000000,
 1077:     Mask = 16#FFFFFFFFFFFFFFFF,
 1078:     <<V_bv:64/unsigned>> = <<V0/float>>,
 1079:     case V_bv band Sign of
 1080:         0 -> (V_bv bxor Sign) band Mask;
 1081:         Sign -> (bnot V_bv) band Mask
 1082:     end.
 1083: 
 1084: %%%
 1085: %%% Utilities.
 1086: %%%
 1087: 
 1088: unvalue(V) ->
 1089:     Abstr = erl_parse:abstract(V),
 1090:     erl_parse:anno_to_term(Abstr).
 1091: 
 1092: value({nil,_}) -> [];
 1093: value({integer,_,X}) -> X;
 1094: value({string,_,X}) -> X;
 1095: value({float,_,X})   -> X;
 1096: value({atom,_,X})    -> X;
 1097: value({tuple,_,Es}) ->
 1098:     list_to_tuple(lists:map(fun(X) -> value(X) end, Es));
 1099: value({cons,_,H,T}) ->
 1100:     [value(H) | value(T)];
 1101: value(Other) ->
 1102:     {value,Value,_} = erl_eval:expr(Other, erl_eval:new_bindings()),
 1103:     Value.
 1104: 
 1105: repeat(_, 0) -> ok;
 1106: repeat(Fun, N) ->
 1107:     Fun(),
 1108:     repeat(Fun, N-1).
 1109: 
 1110: id(I) -> I.
